remarks: The kernel of a scalar product of a functional includes the kernel of the functional.  (The inclusion is proper for the zero product and equality otherwise.)  (Contributed by NM, 9-Oct-2014.)
statement:
lkrsc.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lkrsc.d $e |- D = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lkrsc.k $e |- K = ( Base ` D ) $.
lkrsc.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` D ) $.
lkrsc.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
lkrsc.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` W ) $.
lkrsc.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lkrsc.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lkrsc.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. K ) $.
lkrscss $p |- ( ph -> ( L ` G ) C_ ( L ` ( G oF .x. ( V X. { R } ) ) ) ) $.
